basics.name: Jack R. Featherstone
basics.headline: Fullstack software engineer shipping resilient web and automation systems.

summary.scope: Fullstack engineer delivering modern web apps, automation tools, and distributed systems from brief to steady-state operations.
summary.positioning: Finish the rows I start; own delivery end to end, keep systems reliable, and back claims with live artifacts.
strengths: Translate ambiguous requirements into production-ready fullstack solutions.
Keep repositories orderly with disciplined branching, reviews, and documentation.
Mentor peers through distributed systems challenges while modeling reliable operations.

domains.name: Logistics workflow automation
domains.note: Sanitized architecture diagram and testimonial pending for public share.

domains.name: Distributed systems education
domains.note: Faculty confirmation letter requested to finalize evidence.

domains.note: Private documentation available covering Nextcloud and game server operations.

domains.name: Digital fabrication tooling
domains.note: Backed by BAM Logistics internship output.

experience.role: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant, SER 321 (Distributed Software Systems)
experience.summary: Led distributed systems lab content, authored Java client-server assignment on AWS, and coached cohorts through debugging complex network architectures.
highlights: Designed and shipped a graded Java client-server assignment adopted by course faculty.
Hosted support sessions covering AWS deployment, concurrency, and interface design.
Maintained alignment with faculty and graduate TAs via Slack triage and weekly syncs.

experience.summary: Improve packaging operations and maintain production hardware in a high-throughput logistics environment.
highlights: Implemented workflow adjustments that increased packaging throughput.
Troubleshoot and maintain industrial systems to minimize downtime.

experience.summary: Produced signage and prototypes via CNC laser cutter, converting digital designs into physical deliverables.
highlights: Developed designs in Inkscape to support fabrication requests.
Managed end-to-end fabrication process ensuring accuracy and safety.

projects.name: Rollodex Web App (Capstone)
projects.summary: Delivered a production-grade operations web app under NDA, managing repo hygiene, documentation, and CI while driving backend performance improvements.
highlights: Reduced query latency from 5s to 200ms through backend optimizations.
Enforced documentation and review standards that stabilized release quality.
Aligned stakeholder feedback with sprint execution under NDA constraints.

projects.name: VM Setup with GPU Passthrough
projects.summary: Deployed Windows 10 VMs using KVM/QEMU with GPU passthrough, tuning VFIO and kernel parameters to isolate GPUs for reliable performance.

projects.name: Stellaris & Minecraft Modding
projects.summary: Extended game mechanics and UIs via Java and Lua scripting, including backporting a crash fix for a private modpack.

projects.name: Self-hosted Infrastructure
projects.summary: Designed and maintained Nextcloud, game servers, and automation workflows across home lab hardware.

education.institution: Arizona State University, Ira A. Fulton Schools of Engineering

notes: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant for SER 321 (Distributed Software Systems).
